name: Gribbin Head walk at Fowey Estuary, Lantic Bay

ai.summary: A coastal 8.2 km loop along Gribbin Head with views over the Fowey Estuary and Lantic Bay. A moderate hike featuring clifftop paths, opportunities for wildlife and photography, and sweeping sea panoramas.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged coastal terrain with a mix of well-trodden paths, narrow cliff-edge sections, steps, and rocky, uneven ground. Expect exposed, windy sections and muddy patches after rain. Footing can be slippery near the cliff tops; stay well back from the edges and watch for erosion.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times and weather before setting off. Coastal paths can be slippery when wet and exposed to wind; wear sturdy boots and bring layers. Keep a safe distance from cliff edges, especially with children or dogs. Carry water and a small map or offline navigation on your phone; tell someone your route and expected return time. Be aware of shorter daylight during winter months and plan accordingly.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation on phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn; can be enjoyed year-round with proper gear and weather awareness.

seo.meta_description: Explore an 8.2 km moderate coastal hike along Gribbin Head with views over the Fowey Estuary and Lantic Bay. Includes cliff paths, sea views, and practical safety tips.
